bite: On 5 February 2021, in Panama City, Panama, residents of several neighborhoods around Tocumen demonstrated to demand that the transport authorities consider their petition to provide better road access to their communities. [size=no report]
On 4 February 2021, in San Antonio, Veraguas, residents of the Villa Marina neighborhood demonstrated and blocked the highway to demand the provision of drinking water. [size=no report]

On 4 February 2021, in Panama City, Panama, members of the Association of Restaurants, Bars and Clubs, the Association of Theater and several other groups demonstrated to demand the end of coronavirus restrictions and to be allowed to run their businesses. [size=no report]

On 3 February 2021, in Panama City, Panama, fishermen demonstrated the second day in a row against a new law that regulates fishing and demanded that president uses his veto to cancel the bill. [size=no report]
On 3 February 2021, in Panama City, Panama, a group of women demonstrated against femicide and domestic violence. [size=no report]
On 3 February 2021, in Chiriqui, Chiriqui, fishermen demonstrated against a new law that regulates fishing and demanded that the president keeps his promise to support them. [size=no report]
On 2 February 2021, in Panama City, Panama, fishermen demonstrated and marched to the National Assembly to express their disagreement with a new law that regulates fishing. [size=no report]

On 2 February 2021, in Arraijan, Panama Oeste, a group of former government employees, including the former deputy mayor of Arraijan, demonstrated in front of the city hall to demand the payment of their salaries. They claim that 150 of them were still not paid for their work in the former municipal administration that ended in 2019. [size=no report]

On 1 February 2021, in Panama City, Panama, young members of the Achieving Goals party (RM) demonstrated in front of the National Public Service Authority (ASEP) against plans to cut off electricity and raise the retirement age. [size=no report]

On 21 January 2021, in Colon, Colon, a group of unemployed people demonstrated in front of the Directorate of Social Assistance to demand employment. The protesters tried to get access to the office building, but were stopped by the police with tasers. 12 people were arrested, among them a deputy of the Central American Parliament and member of the Democratic Change party (CD). [size=no report]

On 20 January 2021, in Panama City, Panama, members of the Achieving Goals party (RM) and other people demonstrated as part of the project 'Rescuing Panama' in various locations of the capital to criticise the government's handling of the economic and coronavirus crises. During nationwide protests, they demanded prompt actions and claimed that the government abuses the situation to hinder the opposition's right to protest. [size=no report]

A journalist photographer covering the protest was also attacked by police officers and had two ribs broken. [size=no report]

On 9 April 2018, a group of people from Jesus Nazareth community, at the shore of Chagres river (Panama District), staged a protest against their eviction by the authorities, demanding a place to live.

On 9 April 2018, inhabitants from Penonome (Penonome, Cocle) took to the streets to protest against the poor conditions of Aquilino Tejeira hospital, blocking Via Interamericana for 20 minutes and marching from the hospital to Parque Ocho de Diciembre.

On 9 April 2018, students and teachers from Instituto Profesional y Tecnico (IPT) de Veraguas staged a protest, blocking the main road towards Canto del Llano, in Santiago de Veraguas (Santiago, Veraguas), against the delay in the construction of the institution, which was meant to be built already but the construction of which is currently stopped.

On 7 April 2018, unidentified actors set car on fire. The car belonged to a public servant for the Judicial Body working as the coordinator for the defence of victims. The events occured right outside her property in David (David, Chiriqui).
On 6 April 2018, health workers from Aquilino Tejeira hospital in Penonome (Penonome, Cocle) took to the streets to protest against the state of the hospital and to demand for a better budget for it.

On 6 April 2018, the owners of school buses blocked for 30 minutes Via Panamericana in La Pesa, La Chorrera (La Chorrera, Panama Oeste) in protest against illegal student transportation in the sector.
On 5 April 2018, inhabitants from 7 de Septiembre sector, Arraijan (Arraijan, Panama Oeste) staged a protest in Via Interamericana against the lack of water in the sector.

On 5 April 2018, retired people and pensioners in David (David, Chiriqui) blocked streets in the vicinity of Parque Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra, in David, to demand Juan Carlos Varela's government raise their pensions and Christmas bonus, as well as provide medication and specialized doctors to the hospitals in the country.
On 5 April 2018, teachers staged a protest outside the headquarters of the Presidency of the Republic in Panama city (Panama, Panama) demanding the payment of their salaries.

On 5 April 2018, parents and teachers from Virgen de Guadalupe school in La Chorrera (La Chorrera, Panama Oeste) blocked the road in front of the school to protest against the poor water service in the school.
On 4 April 2018, inhabitants from Chupampa (Santa Maria, Herrera) took to the streets to protest against the lack of water in the community and to demand their right to water.
On 3 April 2018, inhabitants from 7 de Septiembre sector, Arraijan (Arraijan, Panama Oeste) partially blocked the road towards Puente de las Americas in protest about the lack of water.

On 2 April 2018, indigenous peoples from Camaron and Hato Corotu communities in Ngabe Bugle blocked Via Interamericana at San Juan (San Lorenzo, Chiriqui) to protest against the government of Juan Carlos Varela and demand that he fulfill the commitments made to build roads and appoint more teachers in the region.

On 2 April 2018, students and parents from school Pablo Emilio Corsen blocked the entrance to the school and then marched to the international airport Enrique Malek in David (David, Chiriqui) and blocked the access to it to protest that the school has not opened yet and their children are missing classes, and to demand that their children are transferred to the schools they attended previously, La Primavera.

On 29 March 2018, in La Chorrera, Panama Oeste, health workers of Nicolas Alejo Solano Hospital protested during a visit of the Minister of Heath, demanding for the hiring of specialists and for insulin and other essential medicines. The protesters first blocked a road and than marched to the hospital where the minister was having a meeting. the Minister of Health argued that he is working to solve the problems of medicines and specialists

On 27 March 2018, in Penonome, Cocle, health workers of the Aquilino Tejeira Hospital protested in front of the Hospital because of lack of infrastructure and specialists. The protesters said the conditions of the Hospital are precarious.
On 23 March 2018, in Panama City (Bella Vista), workers from Idaan, the National Aqueducts and Sewers Institute, protested to demand raises to perform their work. [size=no report]

On 22 March 2018, in La Chorrera, neighbours of Pacora River marched in defence of the river. The protesters ask for the government to stop giving construction permits alongside the river and allowing some companies to exploit the materials of the river.

On 22 March 2018, in Santiago de Veraguas (Veraguas), students, teachers and parents from the Manuel H de Perez school and their family members protested demanding compliance to prior agreements. [size=no report]
SUNTRACS: Single Union of Construction and Associated Workers; Labour Group (Panama)

On 21 March 2018, in Donoso District, Colon, members of the SUNTRACS labour union protested in front of a Minera Panama mine, blocking the project. The unionists demanded an agreement on working conditions and a deal similar to that reached with the STM union group. At the end of the day the company and labour union reached an agreement, ending eight days of protests.

On 21 March 2018, in La Chorrera, teachers and parents of the Moises Castillo Ocana School protested in front of the regional branch of the Ministry of Education to demand the opening of the school. According to the protesters the classrooms are not ready and in conditions for the classes.
On 21 March 2018, in Puerto Armuelles (Chiriqui), students from the Rio Mar school, as well as their family members, protested to demand the nomination of new staff. [size=no report]
SUNTRACS: Single Union of Construction and Associated Workers; Labour Group (Panama)

On 20 March 2018, in Donoso District, Colon, members of the SUNTRACS labour union protested in front of a Minera Panama mine, blocking the project. The unionists demanded an agreement on working conditions and a deal similar to that reached with the STM union group.

On 20 March 2018, in Pacora, Panama, inhabitants of Altos de San Francisco protested in front of the aqueduct water's treatment plant. The protesters demanded the resumption of the water delivery service that has been suspended for two weeks.

On 20 March 2018, in Panama City (Bella Vista), relatives and victims of the dietilennglycon poisoning case in 2006 staged a protest to demand justice for the victims and the provision of the medicines and required medical attention. [size=no report]
SUNTRACS: Single Union of Construction and Associated Workers; Labour Group (Panama)

On 19 March 2018, in Donoso District, Colon, members of the SUNTRACS labour union protested in front of a Minera Panama mine, blocking the project. The unionists demanded an agreement on working conditions and a deal similar to that reached with the STM union group.

On 19 March 2018, in Las Tablas, Los Santos, corn producers block the national road to Las Tablas during 20 minutes as a protest. The protesters said the government is permitting the entrance of foreign corn, preventing local producers from selling their products.The producers threw corn to the street as a protest.
On 19 March 2018, in Villa Unida (Panama), community members protested against the lack of adequate water provision. [size=no report]
SUNTRACS: Single Union of Construction and Associated Workers; Labour Group (Panama)

On 18 March 2018, in Donoso District, Colon, members of the SUNTRACS labour union protested in front of a Minera Panama mine, blocking the project. The unionists demanded an agreement on working conditions and a deal similar to that reached with the STM union group.
SUNTRACS: Single Union of Construction and Associated Workers; Labour Group (Panama)

On 17 March 2018, in Donoso District, Colon, members of the SUNTRACS labour union protested in front of a Minera Panama mine, blocking the project. The unionists demanded an agreement on working conditions and a deal similar to that reached with the STM union group.

On 16 March 2018, in Colon, teachers and students of the University Regional Centre and members of the Single Union of Construction and Associated Workers SUNTRACS blocked a road and protested against the bad conditions of the schools of the province. The protesters are demanding an answer from the Ministry of Education.
SUNTRACS: Single Union of Construction and Associated Workers; Labour Group (Panama)

On 16 March 2018, in Donoso District, Colon, members of the SUNTRACS labour union protested in front of a Minera Panama mine, blocking the project. The unionists demanded an agreement on working conditions and a deal similar to that reached with the STM union group.

On 15 March 2018, in Buena Vista, Colon, inhabitants of Nueva Esperanza community blocked the road that connects the community to a mining company. The protesters demand the building of a paved road, because the dust and mod of the current road is affecting the health of the people. The community has been demanding the same for 34 years. The police forces managed to talk to the protesters and convince them to unblock the road.
SUNTRACS: Single Union of Construction and Associated Workers; Labour Group (Panama)

On 15 March 2018, in Donoso District, Colon, members of the SUNTRACS labour union protested in front of a Minera Panama mine, blocking the project. The unionists demanded an agreement on working conditions and a deal similar to that reached with the STM union group.

On 15 March 2018, in La Chorrera, Panama Oeste, at least 700 students marched to the Ministry of Education branch in a protest to demand better classrooms and labs. The students also demanded the presence of policemen to protect students during the night, because they have been robbed frequently.
SUNTRACS: Single Union of Construction and Associated Workers; Labour Group (Panama)

On 14 March 2018, in Donoso District, Colon, members of the SUNTRACS labour union protested in front of a Minera Panama mine, blocking the project. The unionists demanded an agreement on working conditions and a deal similar to that reached with the STM union group.

On 14 March 2018, in Arraijan, Panama Oeste, inhabitants of Loma del Rio and other communities protested against the lack of water delivery services during the last five years. The protesters demand a meeting with local authorities and the Institute of Aqueducts and Sewers IDAAN.
SUNTRACS: Single Union of Construction and Associated Workers; Labour Group (Panama)

On 14 March 2018, in Panama city, members of the Single Union of Construction and Associated Workers SUNTRACS marched through the main roads of the city to protest against corruption and to support the protest in the mines of Minera Panama and in Colon. The marches blocked the main roads to access Panama city.
FAC: Wide Front for Colon; Labour Group (Panama)
On 14 March 2018, in Colon (Colon), protesters from the FAC, the Broad Network of Colon, marched demanding more work opportunities and investment in the area. [size=no report]
On 13 March 2018, in Santiago de Veraguas (Veraguas), nurses protested demanding the nomination of new staff. [size=no report]

On 13 March 2018, in Colon, the Union of workers of FEMSA blocked during one hour several roads of Colon and the country. The unionist said the protest is a show of solidarity to the civic movement that is denouncing that the urban transformation of Colon aims to displace poor population. The government denies the accusations.

On 13 March 2018, in Panama city, Wounaan Indigenous people arrived to the Ministry of Environment demanding for collective property titles for their lands. The protesters say they will remain until they are heard and their demands are met. This is the second day of the protest. [size=no report]

On 13 March 2018, in the city of Colon, a riot that began after a peaceful demonstration against a governmental project that affects the community became tense: 39 people were arrested and 5 were injured, including four police agents. Six shops were vandalised and a police vehicle was burnt.

On 12 March 2018, in Macaracas, Los Santos, inhabitants of Bombacho community blocked the road to Tonosi, in a protest because the works to fix the road have caused damages in the aqueduct and sewers, the road and it is producing too much dust. The construction crew said the works will continue tomorrow, after being closed since January.
ACPTA: Association of the Highlands Production Community

On 12 March 2018, in Volcan, Chiriqui, onion producers of the Association of the Highlands Production Community ACPTA gave away onions to all the drivers and pedestrians who passed by. The producers are demonstrating to demand that the government comply with the law and take away imported onions after 120 days of being in the market. The onion producers argue that the imported onions are affecting the market and the government is favouring importers and not abiding by the law.

On 12 March 2018, in Panama city, Wounaan Indigenous people arrived to the Ministry of Environment demanding for collective property titles for their lands. The protesters say they will remain until their demands are heard and met. [size=no report]
On 11 March 2018, in Panama City (Bella Vista), protesters gathered in front of the National Assembly to protest against corruption. [size=no report]

On 10 March 2018, in La Colorada, parents and teachers of the local school protested during a communal lunch in front of the locked school facilities. The protesters said they will continue protesting until their demands are addressed.

On 8 March 2018, in Tocumen, Panama, inhabitants of Hacienda Santa Fe neighbourhood protested blocking the main street of the area. The protesters demand for attention to the sewage and robbery, which are problems they have already exposed to the authorities. After some minutes the protesters decided to unblock the street.

On 7 March 2018, in La Colorada, Los Santos, a protest of teachers and parents was dispersed by the police. The protesters asked for the hiring of two teachers and demanded to talk to the governor and a representative of the Ministry of Education. The parents locked the school of La Colorada and said that they won't let classes to begin until their demands are addressed.

On 7 March 2018, in La Chorrera, Panama Oeste, diabetic patients protested in front of Nicolas Alejo Solano Hospital, demanding for the hiring of specialists and for insulin and other essential medicines. More than 200 diabetic patients are being mistreated because of lack of medicine.

On 6 March 2018, in Panama city, more than 10.000 people marched against egalitarian marriage and ''to defend family''. Civic organizations, religious groups and pedestrians participated of the march. No violence was reported.

On 5 March 2018, in Colon, students, teachers and parents of the San Vicente de Paul School blocked the street in a protest against the Urban Renovation Project of Colon. The protesters reported sewage in the street and other damages to the school.

On 5 March 2018, in San Juan, Colon, a group of parents protested in front of Desmond Byam School and blocked a road. The protesters demanded the resignation of the director of the school and accused them of corruption. They declared the director to be a non-welcomed person.

On 5 March 2018, in Veracruz, Panama Oeste, students and parents of the Veracruz School blocked the main entrance to the area. They demanded a meeting with the Ministry of Education and denounce the government's negligence.

On 5 March 2018, in Panama City (Bella Vista), teachers, family members of students and students protested against the conditions of the school building, which had been closed for sanitary reasons since 2017, without improvement. [size=no report]

On 2 March 2018, in Santiago, Veraguas, inhabitants of La Pradera neighbourhood blocked some roads to protest against the bad conditions of the roads and the sewers. The sewage is continuously in the street and it presents a risk to humans, the protesters said. Obs: police forces of El Salvador went to the location to disperse the protesters, but no clashes were reported by the source.

On 1 March 2018, in Paso Canoas, Chiriqui, inhabitants of the area blocked the Inter American Road in a protest to demand water delivery service. The protesters said blocking the road is the only way the authorities attend their demands, and that they are tired of the continuous breaches of the Institute of Aqueducts and Sewers IDAAN.

On 28 February 2018, in Atalaya, Veraguas, inhabitants of the communities of La Mata and La Montanuela protested to demand the construction of a new road to access their communities. The protesters tried to block the Inter American Road but the police dispersed them.

On 28 February 2018, in Arraijan, Panama Oeste, teachers and parents blocked the Inter American Road to protest against the delay in repairs to the Technical and Professional Institute Fernando de Lesseps. The protesters demand an explanation by the Ministry of Education about the delay in the project.
On 26 February 2018, in Panama City (Bella Vista), community members protested against the poor conditions of the Juan Demostenes Arosemena school in Chilibre neighborhood. [size=no report]

On 26 February 2018, in San Juan, Colon, a group of parents protested in front of Desmond Byam School because of the precarious state of the building. The protesters demanded improvements of the building.

On 26 February 2018, in Cativa, Colon, a group of teachers protested because of the precarious state of the Technical and Professional Institute. The protesters argue that the building is collapsing. The teachers blocked a road and ask for the presence of the Minister of Education.
On 26 February 2018, in La Pintada (Cocle), members of the Orari area protested against the poor state of local roads despite governmental agreements to fix it. [size=no report]

On 22 February 2018, in San Miguelito (San Miguelito), hundreds of persons protested at the Electoral Court to demand the emission of free voter licenses following the spreading of fake news on it. [size=hundreds]

On 22 February 2018, in David, Chiriqui, inhabitants of Las Lomas area blocked the Inter American Road during 30 minutes until the police dispersed them. The protesters ask for water delivery service, since they haven't received the service in the last two weeks.

On 22 February 2018, in Nance, San Carlos, Panama Oeste, inhabitants closed the Inter American Road as a protest because outsiders are closing the access to the beaches, affecting fishermen, visitors and the community.
On 21 February 2018, in San Miguelito (San Miguelito), community members protested against the lack of sanitation in their communities. [size=no report]
On 21 February 2018, in San Miguelito (San Miguelito), business owners protested against an eviction order and demanded a dialogue with the government. [size=no report]
On 21 February 2018, in San Miguelito (San Miguelito), community members protested against a planned eviction from their residence. [size=no report]
On 21 February 2018, in Panama City (Bella Vista), residents and business owners protested against ongoing reforms and how they were conducted by the government. [size=no report]

On 19 February 2018, in David, Chiriqui, beans producers protested in front of the Institute of Agricultural Marketing IMA building. The protesters demand that the IMA guarantee the marketing of the beans because, due to imports, the price of the beans are not enough to pay the costs of production. More than 1.000 producers are affected.
On 15 February 2018, in Kuna Nega, Panama, protesters blocked the Panama - Colon Highway. The protesters ask for water delivery service.

On 6 February 2018, in Colon, a group of micro-entrepreneurs protested because due to the renovation of Colon their families have been moved away and they don't have a definite answer about where they are going to be located. They ask for a meeting with the Minister of Housing and Public Works.

On 6 February 2018, in Dolega, Chiriqui, inhabitants protested in front of the CUSA construction enterprise because some of the works they are doing in the area affected the aqueduct and the population is not getting water delivery service. The director of the Institute of Aqueducts and Sewers IDAAN said they are working to fix the aqueduct and in 48 hours the service will be available.
On 5 February 2018, in Barrio Colon, Panama Oeste, around 20 protesters closed the Interamerican Road. The protesters ask for water delivery service.

On 4 February 2018, in Boquete, Chiriqui, inhabitants protested in front of an unfinished clinic building. The protesters said the construction has been stopped for various months and the community needs the clinic.
On 4 February 2018, in Panama, the population banged pans and pots in protest against corruption in the country. The sound of the pans was heard all over the city of Panama from 7:00 to 7:15 pm.

On 2 February 2018, in David, Chiriqui, inhabitants of Los Abanicos were dispersed by the police during a protest. The protesters were dispersed because they closed the Interamerican Road. The protesters are asking for the legalization of their properties and the delivery of electricity.

On 2 February 2018, in Colon, inhabitants of Calle 13 area protested because of a problem with sewage. The protesters said the area is full of mosquitoes and the circulation is difficult because of the water.

On 31 January 2018, in Panama, inhabitants of Lucha Franco and El Vallecito neighbourhoods protested because of the lack of water delivery service. They also ask for the Ministry of Public Works to fix the road. The protesters blocked the Tranistmica Road.
On 30 January 2018, in Panama City (Bella Vista), a group of protesters gathered to support the nomination of a judge in the court. [size=no report]

On 30 January 2018, in Colon, inhabitants of two communities protested against the Ministry of Housing and Territorial Planning (Miviot). The protesters asked for work to resume on some buildings that are meant to shelter people affected by a fire in their neighbourhoods. The protesters blocked the entrance to a community and after that they marched to MIVIOT's offices.

On 29 January 2018, in Santa Rita Arriba, Colon, neighbours protested because of the lack of water delivery. The protesters blocked the road that connects Panama and Colon, affecting the traffic. The neighbours asked for a meeting with the regional director of the Institute of Aqueducts and Sewers IDAAN.

On 28 January 2018, in Veracruz, Arraijan, Panama Oeste, neighbours protested against the construction of illegal stores in the beach. The neighbours had already presented a complaint to the Municipal Council. The protesters argue that the mayor and an engineer are giving permits to build the stores but that it is forbidden by law.

On 27 January 2018, in La chorrera, Panama Oeste, workers of La Chorrera International Fair had to be dispersed by the police during a protest. The protesters are angry because a judicial sequestration of the Fair that is affecting them all. The workers said the sequestration has political interests. the mayor of La Chorrera promised to provide his legal team in order to defend the interests of the workers.

On 25 January 2018, in Santiago de Veraguas (Veraguas), community members from Martincito demonstrated against the construction of a sanitation treatment plant right next to the community school as it would pose a health hazard. They burned tyres and blocked trucks from entering the community. [size=no report]

On 24 January 2018, in Colon, neighbours of Altos de Los Lagos Housing Project protested in front of the project because the company is not hiring people from Colon and it takes away opportunities for the locals who have the skills needed. The protesters asked the company and the Ministry of Housing to hire local manpower. The police forces of El Salvador patrolled the area of the project in order to prevent any kind of violence or vandalism actions.

On 23 January 2018, in Piedras Gordas community, La Pintada, Cocle, peasants of the community blocked the road that connects to Coclesito and the mine, protesting because of the bad conditions of the road. The protest closed the road for several hours and the miners were affected. The peasants argue that blocking the road is the only way to get the attention of the authorities. The Ministry of Public Works said the works to improve the road are programmed to begin in March.

On 23 January 2018, a group of neighbours blocked the Central Avenue of Colon city. The protesters asked for water delivery, as they have been affected by public works in the city that affected the water delivery service. No other details were reported by the source.
On 23 January 2018, in Panama City (Bella Vista), protesters gathered to protest against corruption in front of the Public Prosecutor's Office. [size=no report]

On 19 January 2018, in Arraijan district, Panama Oeste, ex-policemen protested and closed the Interamerican Road. The protesters ask for the payment of social benefits owed to them. More than 9,000 retired policemen are demanding the payment of those obligations. police forces intervened to open the road without using any kind of violence. the protesters moved to the Ministry of Security to meet the minister.

On 19 January 2018, in Panama city, inhabitants of a shelter in El Chorrillo neighbourhood were dispersed by the police during a peaceful protest. No injuries were reported. The protesters were closing a street, asking for better conditions of the shelters and complaining about the presence of rats and other animals, and the structure of the building is collapsing. They are living in the shelter after a fire that burned their houses.

Around 18 January 2018 (as reported), in Colon (Colon), business owners protested against the eviction of 200 nearby families and demanded a plan from the government on how they could be compensated for their losses. [size=no report]

On 17 January 2018, in Arraijan, Panama Oeste, inhabitants of Loma del Rio neighbourhood protested because their community has no electricity service and it is necessary to operate the water delivery system. The electricity was supposed to be ready five years ago. The Natural Gas Enterprise FENOSA, responsible for the electrification, said it will be ready by the end of the month.

On 17 January 2018, in Urbanization San Antonio, in David, Chiriqui, inhabitants protested today because they still don't have the electricity service promised to be ready a month before. The protesters asked for an immediate solution to their need.
On 11 January 2018, in La Villa de los Santos, in Los Santos, taxi drivers protested peacefully. The protesters are asking for permissions to move freely in some parts of the Risaralda Valley.
On 11 January 2018, in Panama City (Bella Vista), workers from the Agriculture Development Bank protested demanding the payment of outstanding bonuses. [size=no report]

On 9 January 2018, in David, Chiriqui, retired people protested peacefully and closed the roads to access Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra Park. The protesters are looking for the payment of their bonuses and an increase in their pensions.

On 9 January 2018, in Panama, thousands of people marched in a peaceful protest against corruption. The protesters ask for prison for those who rob the state, and are asking for information and punishment for people involved in corruption scandals like the Odebrecht case. Several civil society organization participated in the protest.

On 5 January 2018, in La Arena, in Chitre, members of the community met in order to protest about the construction of the cycling road, which they say will affect their properties. The governor of the province offered a meeting in two days to solve the situation.
AMP: Maritime Authority of Panama; Labour Group (Panama)

On 6 January 2018, in Panama, employees of the Maritime Authority of Panama AMP blocked Balboa Avenue and proceeded to protest because they haven't gotten their bonuses for 2016 and 2017. The protesters warned that if they don't get what they are asking for, they won't let any ship set sail

On 3 January 2018, in Panama City, members of Federico Britton National Movement MOCONA, protested in a pacific march from Plaza 5 de Mayo to the Presidency Building. The protesters ask for housing and the right to a shelter. Many indigenous people of the Ngabe Bugle ethnic group participated in the protest.
